headline: Adobe Downgrades Spotlight AI Competition And Questions Around Growth Durability
summary: Multiple major investment banks have downgraded Adobe, pointing to concerns about slowing revenue growth. Analysts are flagging rising competition in AI tools as a risk to Adobe's core software offerings. The downgrades highlight worries about potential structural changes in the software industry affecting Adobe. Adobe, ticker NasdaqGS:ADBE, is coming under sharper scrutiny as investors reassess its position in a fast changing software sector. The stock closed at $246.68 and has seen a...

summary: This growth is fueled by increased adoption of digital learning platforms, enhanced internet accessibility, and a rising demand for flexible education solutions. headline: Qualcomm gains after Wells sees upto $7 bln revenue from data center chips
summary: Investing.com -- Qualcomm, which unveiled two artificial intelligence chips for data centers last year in its efforts beyond a stagnant smartphones market, could generate $5 billion to $7 billion in annual revenue from data center chips starting in 2027, says Wells Fargo. Shares are up more than 2% in Tuesday premarket trading. Analysts upgrade the stock to Equal weight and bumped its price target to $150 from $135.
